name: Manual Testers (may or may not work)
Dashboard Theme : Modern Dark
info:
# Modern Dark Theme for node-red-dashboard

Inspired by Victor Lucachi with his [Node Red Dashboard Concept](https://dribbble.com/shots/10356530-Node-Red-Dashboard-Concept) on Dribbble. Thank you for your work.

## Customize

1. Go on dashboard customisation tab (At the right of Debug Console).
2. Select the style `Dark`.
3. Pick the color you want. Example `#66B5F8`

## Buttons

Use `2x2` size for buttons with icon and text on the screenshot

info:
- FS progresses along at a fixed path
- FS communication is "one-way", so to speak
- Teams can ping it down as it grows
- If you get to it before it progresses to second window, 
  you get damage prevention bonus

Config Setup Instructions
info:
Config for the field contains the mapping of UUID (as written to each arduino board) and the node id as defined in the field diagram (containing LBO, RBO, etc)

1. Write a text file in the following format:
EDGE_UUID,EDGE_NODE_ID
7452C441,LBO
7452C442,LBM
...

2. Place on the raspberry pi in this location:
/home/pi/field-config.csv
    2.a -- emergency option, you can force a config down in the "Write config to file"  flow below -- see instructions there

3. Create and/or drop then create the "Create Config Table"
4. Run "Load Config File into Config Table"

sql:
CREATE TABLE FIELD_CONFIG (
  EDGE_UUID TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  EDGE_NODE_ID TEXT
)
name: Create Config Table
Load Config File into Config Table
info:
See instructions on top -- but file is:
/home/pi/field-config.csv

name: Construct SQL
Construct SQL
extract nodeid
Publish Node ID to edge Node
Initialize Edge Nodes
info:
Edge nodes report in when they come online with a UUID
UUID is accessed from the DB, and returned as a Node ID (as defined by our field layout/diagram)

See Load Config File into Config Table flow for how to edit this

Each Arduino needs a unique id written into eeprom using -> https://github.com/lanceriedel/burn-uuid-eeprom

name: Write config to file
info:
If you can't access the raspberry pi file system -- you can put the config here and force write it
BUT -- you have to send as binary so that it retains the newlines

For example:
EDGE_UUID,EDGE_NODE_ID
7452C441,LBO
7452C442,LBM
7BD83A13,RBM
709CDBFF,RBO


Be sure to hit the elipses ...  so that you can see what you are typing.  
Also note that it will change to binary as soon as you send -- but it will work fine

name: Emergency Use! Write config -  (you need to load it after)
info:
If you can't access the raspberry pi file system -- you can put the config here and force write it
BUT -- you have to send as binary so that it retains the newlines
For example:
EDGE_UUID,EDGE_NODE_ID
7452C441,LBO
7452C442,LBM
7BD83A13,RBM
709CDBFF,RBO




Be sure to hit the elipses ...  so that you can see what you are typing.  
Also note that it will change to binary as soon as you send -- but it will work fine
